long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
VISUAL CUES WHEN DRAG-AND-DROPPING FILES

It's really annoying not knowing if the website will accept your files when you drag and drop them into the window.

You think that this website can take your files directly, and then BOOM, they open in a new window or you re-download them again.

I know, it's an incredibly niche issue, and not really that mission-critical. But it is a pet peeve of mine. So, I'm sharing this in case somebody happens to also find this incredibly annoying,

This extension adds a visual cue shown when dragging a file into the browser window. 

- When the website ACCEPTS drag and dropping a file, the cursor will have a green label next to it
- When the website DOES NOT accept the drag and drop, and therefore if you drop files it will open them in a separate window, the cursor will have a red label saying "NO DROP".

Hopefully this makes the web a bit more user-friendly and accessible for some.
